model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
Speaker B: Have you been hiking lately?
Speaker A: Yes I did actually. I lead some friends on a hike in a local trail last weekend. They got tired really quickly as they never go hiking they told me.
Speaker B: Sounds like me. I am not a fan of the outdoors. Did your friends manage to have a good time anyway?
Speaker A: Oh they did. We had some nice snacks along the way. Oddly enough, we had some trail mix that someone had made at home. It was quite tasty. We also had some juice and water packed to make sure everyone stayed hydrated. You should join us one day! I'll make it as fun as possible.
Speaker B: I will someday. just not in the summer when all the bugs are out! Where do you go hiking the most?
Speaker A: I like to go hiking in the local trails here. I am familiar with them and there's so many routes that I can take. Sadly, the bugs are as bad here as they are anywhere else.....
Speaker B: They can't be that bad in the fall right? I hope? Do you camp most every weekend?

MEMORY:
Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks, which has led to them planning several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail. They also lead hikes for the group they camp with, which are usually an hour or two long, but Speaker A is now nervous about the Appalachian Trail hike, as they don't usually do full day hikes. Additionally, Speaker A is a personal trainer who loves camping in remote areas and is comfortable around animals in the woods, although they admit a bear would make them jumpy.

OUTPUT:

Brief explanation: The MEMORY contains information that Speaker A is an experienced camper and hiker, who has led hikes and has plans for more extensive ones. There is a mention of their familiarity and comfort with hiking trails, which connects with the DIALOGUE CONTEXT where Speaker A is discussing their familiarity with local trails and making hiking enjoyable for friends. This provides a background that could be helpful to generate further dialogue about hiking and outdoor activities.

Judgement: Yes
